file_content.text: Come on back. I want to thank you in person.
Recon droids are still picking up Esh-kha activity. Get down there and stop them.
You made it. Good. Now listen up--got a possible lead on that "World Razer."
Skylast here. Got another crisis brewing in your neck of the woods. Top priority.
Hello? This thing still work? This is General Skylast, Republic Infantry. Got a crisis brewing in your sector that requires your immediate attention.
Recon droids picked up a large contingent of Esh-kha headed for the prison bowels. Elite soldiery, very dangerous.
Led by none other than the Esh-kha's patriarch, Gore Claw. If that maniac's involved, it's a sure bet they're up to something.
You think this has something to do with the World Razer.
Doubt it's a coincidence.
Can't think of anything else that would rally the Esh-kha like this.
Must be something important down there. Question is, what?
Whatever it is, must be big.
Couldn't say. Still plenty of Esh-kha sealed away in the lower vaults--other nasties, too.
Sounds like you've run into this Gore Claw before.
You know him?
He's killed dozens of my men. Wants nothing more than to lead the Esh-kha on a galaxy-conquering spree.
Call me when you've got something more concrete.
You're just speculating.
It's just a hunch, but a man can either trust his gut or get plugged in it.
The Esh-kha are gonna need one heck of a trump card if they want off this rock. My money's on the World Razer.
We've intercepted a few Esh-kha transmissions. Keep hearing references to something called a "World Razer." Whatever it is, they're trying to awaken it.
Dug up some records on the thing. Very apocalyptic. Saw phrases like "destroyer of planets" and "eater of stars" more often than I'd like.
We need to keep that thing as far away from the Republic as possible.
We can't let it escape.
If there's one thing Belsavis is good for, it's keeping the galaxy's scum out of the Republic's hair.
Hard to believe a creature of such destructive power could exist.
A dangerous find.
Seen a lot of weird things in my time, but a planet-eating monster takes the cake.
A target that big calls for some serious ordnance.
I'm not equipped for that.
And you want me to stop it with my... blaster?
I'll need a bigger gun.
The entire Republic fleet may not have the firepower to take that thing down. That's why we keep it here, imprisoned.
What could the Esh-kha possibly gain by releasing something like that?
So why free it?
They have two things on their minds: escape and genocide. Seems the World Razer will facilitate both.
Don't suppose you've found anything on how we destroy this thing.
Just tell me how to kill it.
Nothing substantial yet. I suspect killing it is out of the question, but we may have other options.
Overheard some Esh-kha comm chatter... something about disabling a "failsafe." Could be our ticket to stopping all this nonsense.
The transmission came from a nearby cave. Lots of Esh-kha assembling there. Going to need you down there to see what this failsafe is all about.
Whatever the Esh-kha are up to, I'll put a stop to it.
I'll see this through.
What am I supposed to do once I get there?
Then what?
See this through to the end.
This mission will take you deeper into Belsavis than anyone's gone. It's a dangerous world down there, but the Republic--heck, maybe the galaxy--is counting on you. Good luck.
Absolutely not. [Refuse quest]
That World Razer could wake any second.
Not much of a choice.
Fine, if I must.
